title: The pupal moulting fluid has evolved social functions in ants - Nature

last_post.content:
A new paper finds that #ant pupae secrete a molting fluid that is essential for young larvae to survive. At the same time, the pupae die if the fluid is not taken away by adult #ants (to feed the larvae). This way, the coherence of the ant superstate is strengthened.
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-022-05480-9

title: Examining The Behaviour of a Self Authenticating Mastodon Scraper

last_post.content:
New #Blog: Examining the behaviour of a self authentication #mastodon #scraper bot

In a recent #infosec orientated post I noticed that a bot seemed to be providing credentials alongside it's API requests (although my WAF considered them invalid).

In this post, I take a closer look at

- what that bot does
- how it came to be in possession of creds
- things that admins can do to mitigate against this type of behaviour

https://www.bentasker.co.uk/posts/blog/security/digging-into-the-behaviour-of-a-self-authenticating-mastodon-scraper-bot.html

title: Will GPT-4 get the Monty *Fall* problem correct?

last_post.content:
This question is genius: https://manifold.markets/MatthewBarnett/will-gpt4-get-the-monty-fall-proble

They came up with a tweak to the famous Monty Hall problem where it's obvious that you need to take the *opposite* decision from Monty Hall.

So the question is: will GPT4 be able to solve this tweaked version, or mistake it for the original one? Good mark of intelligence vs. rote learning.

Google Adwords incentivized sites to peddle SEO optimized garbage. Sites who aren't are forced to optimize for email capture so they can market directly to you. Search results now show "news", ads, and SEO spam instead of surfacing information.

You ought to be able to search something on Google and get an answer to your question without signing up for some newsletter

The idea is pretty simple, news sites want Google to index their content so it shows up in search results. So they don't show a paywall to the Google crawler. We benefit from this because the Google crawler will cache a copy of the site every time it crawls it.

This site shows you that cached, unpaywalled version of the page.

https://12ft.io/
